course_title: Special Topics in Music: Music, Sound, and Environment
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 10 / Seats Avail: 5Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as ENVS 285 2)
How can listening contribute to discussions of the environment, distinctly from our other senses? Do the sounds of our environments and communities indicate their health? What place does human-made music have in our world's vast and rich acoustic ecology? Drawing on the fields of ecomusicology and sound studies, in this course we will develop our own responses to these questions and others, through written, audile, and audio-visual texts, and through our own research and creative practices. No previous knowledge of music is required. Music Majors: counts as general elective credit.
course_description: Seminar or lecture series of topics in music. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
sections: Class Nbr: 6116, Section #: 2, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 4-5:15p, Instructor: J. Rust, Status: Open
